document.docAuthor: Barbosa, Julianna Freires & Nessimian, Jorge Luiz
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Buenoa Kirkaldy, 1904 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Nepomorpha: Notonectidae) in northern Brazil: inventory, new records, and new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Buenoa Kirkaldy, 1904 (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Nepomorpha: Notonectidae) in northern Brazil: inventory, new records, and new species

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 38 – 49. 38 – 39. Buenoa pallipes (Fabricius). 38, Lateral view of male rostrum with rostral prong distinctly longer than third rostral segment; 39, Ventral view of male fore leg with stridulatory area on femur and dissimilar teeth on tibia. 40 – 42. Buenoa paranensis Jaczewski. 40, Frontal view of male rostrum; 41, Ventral view of male fore leg with stridulatory area on femur and similar teeth on tibia; 42, Claspers. 43 – 45. Buenoa platycnemis (Fieber). 43, Lateral view of male rostrum distinctly longer than third rostral segment; 44, Ventral view of male fore leg with stridulatory area on femur and similar stridulatory teeth on tibia; 45, Claspers. 46 – 49. Buenoa tarsalis Truxal. 46, Lateral view of male rostrum with rostral prong slightly longer than third rostral segment; 47, Ventral view of male fore leg with stridulatory area on femur and slightly dissimilar teeth on tibia; 48, First tarsal segment of mid-leg deeply emarginate; 49, Claspers. Scale bar: 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Anisops platycnemis Fieber, 1851 : 61
[ Type locality: Portorico St. Thomas Moritz"; Type in Berlin Museum ( Deutschland )]; Champion ( 1901 ): 372 [as synonymous of
Anisops pallipes
]; Torre-Bueno ( 1902 ): 236 [Note: U.S. A].

Buenoa platycnemis : Kirkaldy ( 1904 )
: 123 [New combination; Note: U.S.A. , México , Argentina , Brazil ]; Kirkaldy and Torre- Bueno ( 1909 ): 201 [Note: U.S. A]; Torre-Bueno ( 1909 ): 75 [Record: U.S.A. ]; Hungerford ( 1919 ): 176 [Note; Record: U.S. A]; Truxal ( 1953 ): 1421 [Revision; Distribution and records: U.S. A, México , Panamá , Costa Rica , Cuba , Grand Cayman , Haiti , Jamaica , Puerto Rico , Virgin Islands , Martinique , Colombia , Venezuela , Brazil , Peru ]; Truxal ( 1957 ): 16 [Systematics; expedition in Goiás and Tocantins ( Brazil )]; De Abate ( 1960 ): 21 [Survey: Costa Rica ; Distribution: U.S. A, México , Costa Rica , Grand Cayman , Puerto Rico , Colombia , Peru ]; Nieser ( 1968 ): 133 [Records: Venezuela ]; Nieser ( 1969 ): 96 [Records: Cuba , Antigua and Barbuda ]; Nieser ( 1970 ): 85 [Survey: South America ; Record: Venezuela , Brazil ]; Bachmann ( 1971 ): 605 [Record: Argentina ]; Roback and Nieser ( 1974 ): 45 [Survey: Llanos of Colombia ]; Nieser ( 1975 ): 192 [Might occur in Guyana Region]; Nieser and Alkins-Koo ( 1991 ): 35 [Note: Tobago ]; Padilla-Gil and Nieser ( 1992 ): 79 [Notes; Record: Colombia ]; Bachmann ( 1998 ): 179 [ Argentina ]; Ribeiro et al . ( 1998 ): 118 [Distribution in freshwater bodies; Record: Maricá ( Brazil )]; Padilla-Gil ( 2002 ): 485 [Revision in Colombia ]; López Ruf et al. ( 2003 ): 68 [Survey: Parque Nacional Mburucuyá ( Argentina )]; Herrera Millán ( 2005 ): 117 [Survey: Venezuela ]; Torres et al. ( 2008 ): 135 [Survey: Parque Nacional Calilegua ( Argentina )]; Barbosa et al . ( 2010 b): 561 [Key to
Buenoa
of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil ]; Ribeiro et al . ( 2010 ): 307 [Survey: Rio de Janeiro ( Brazil )]; Heckman ( 2011 ): 482 [Key to
Buenoa
of South America ]; Moreira et al . ( 2011 ): 55 [Check-list of Brazil ].

Comments.
Buenoa platycnemis
has a wide distribution with great color variation, and is similar to
B. pallipes
. The rostral prong of each species originates laterally on the distal region of the third rostral segment and is distinctly longer than this segment ( Fig. 38, 43 ). The rostral prong of
B. platycnemis
protrudes anteriorly at basally; such a projection does not occur in
B. pallipes
. According to Truxal ( 1953 ),
B. platycnemis
differs from
B. pallipes
because of the larger frons, the pronotum shorter with its posterior margin more truncate medially, and a slight differences in the fore femur and rostral prong.
